summary:
The Maya civilization was an ancient culture in Central America, lasting from ancient times until the 1600s. They are known for their impressive temples, unique writing (glyphs), and advanced knowledge in math, astronomy, and art.

The Maya people lived in an area that is now southeastern Mexico, Guatemala, Belize, and parts of Honduras and El Salvador. Over time, they built cities with huge temples and developed a complex writing system. Their cities had ceremonial centers and residential areas.

The Maya had a unique political system with powerful kings and a noble class. They were skilled artists, using various materials to create beautiful crafts. Their religion involved complex rituals and calendars, and they even practiced human sacrifice.
title: Maya civilization
